page.title: 07Housing Questionnaire Data.
page.content: The following points emerged from a 'housing' questionnaire distributed in Mattishall on July 10th.1985. Most dwellings in the village are either bungalows or detached houses. There is a tremendous age range:a great deal of building has occurred within the last ten to twenty years, but there are also a large number of houses between 100 and 400 years old. Most people live in accomodation with three living rooms and three bedrooms,and most dwellings have garages.The average number of inhabitants per dwelling is four. The inhabitants of the village are in the main relative newcomers:few have lived here for more than ten years. Gardens in Mattishall are fairly large,averaging about a quarter of an acre.
